Package com.w10.risk_game.utils

Class MapValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.w10.risk_game.utils.MapValidator
  • public class MapValidator
extends Object
    The MapValidator class provides methods to validate a game map by checking for various conditions such as empty map, non-existent continents or neighbors, self-referencing neighbors, inaccessible countries, and disconnected continents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor Description
      private MapValidator()
      Private constructor to prevent unexpected instance initialization

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected static boolean AreContinentsConnected​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function checks if all continents in a game map are connected and if the number of continents in the map matches the number of continents in the continentIdToCountryIdsMap.
      protected static boolean AreCountriesConnected​(Map<Integer,​Country> p_countryMap)
      The function checks if all countries in a given map are connected to each other.
      protected static Map<Integer,​Map<Integer,​Country>> GetContinentIdToCountryIdsMap​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function `getContinentIdToCountryIdsMap` creates a map that maps continent IDs to maps of country IDs to country objects.
      protected static boolean HasNonExistentContinent​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function checks if there are any countries in the game map that have a non-existent continent.
      protected static boolean HasNonExistentNeighbor​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function checks if any country in a game map has a neighbor that does not exist in the map.
      protected static boolean HasSelfReferencingNeighbor​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function checks if any country in a game map has a neighbor that references itself.
      static boolean IsMapCorrect​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function isMapCorrect checks if a given game map is valid by checking for various conditions such as empty map, non-existent continents or neighbors, self-referencing neighbors, inaccessible countries, and disconnected continents.
      protected static boolean IsMapEmpty​(GameMap p_gameMap)
      The function checks if a game map is empty by verifying if the list of countries or continents is empty.

    • Method Detail

      • IsMapCorrect

        public static boolean IsMapCorrect​(GameMap p_gameMap)
        The function isMapCorrect checks if a given game map is valid by checking for various conditions such as empty map, non-existent continents or neighbors, self-referencing neighbors, inaccessible countries, and disconnected continents.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is of type `GameMap`, which represents a game map. It contains information about the countries, continents, and their connections in the game.
        Returns:
        The method isMapCorrect is returning a boolean value indicating if the map satisfies all conditions.

      • IsMapEmpty

        protected static boolean IsMapEmpty​(GameMap p_gameMap)
        The function checks if a game map is empty by verifying if the list of countries or continents is empty.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is of type `GameMap`, which represents a game map. It contains information about the countries, continents, and their connections in the game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value, which indicates whether the given game map is empty or not.

      • HasNonExistentContinent

        protected static boolean HasNonExistentContinent​(GameMap p_gameMap)
        The function checks if there are any countries in the game map that have a non-existent continent.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is an instance of the `GameMap` class. It represents the game map that contains information about the countries and continents in the game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

        The function checks if any country in a game map has a neighbor that references itself.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is of type `GameMap`, which represents a game map. It contains information about the countries, continents, and their connections in the game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • AreCountriesConnected

        protected static boolean AreCountriesConnected​(Map<Integer,​Country> p_countryMap)
        The function checks if all countries in a given map are connected to each other.
        Parameters:
        p_countryMap - A map that contains the countries as values, where the key is an integer representing the country's ID.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if all the countries in the given map are connected, and false otherwise.

      • AreContinentsConnected

        protected static boolean AreContinentsConnected​(GameMap p_gameMap)
        The function checks if all continents in a game map are connected and if the number of continents in the map matches the number of continents in the continentIdToCountryIdsMap.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is of type `GameMap`, which represents a game map. It contains information about the countries, continents, and their connections in the game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a boolean value.

      • GetContinentIdToCountryIdsMap

        protected static Map<Integer,​Map<Integer,​Country>> GetContinentIdToCountryIdsMap​(GameMap p_gameMap)
        The function `getContinentIdToCountryIdsMap` creates a map that maps continent IDs to maps of country IDs to country objects.
        Parameters:
        p_gameMap - The parameter `p_gameMap` is of type `GameMap`, which represents a game map. It contains information about the countries, continents, and their connections in the game.
        Returns:
        The method is returning a map that maps continent IDs to maps of country IDs to countries.
